data.title: Controversial Miss Hong Kong
data.meta_description:
Greetings to readers.
 Today, I am going to talk about Miss Hong Kong that is highly controversial sometimes.Year 2017 is a difference that our Miss Astro was held before Miss Hong Kong, that Miss Astro was completed on 1st day of Eid-ul-fitr, and this week is our Miss Hong Kong that is 45th Miss Hong Kong from the year of 1973.Compared to Miss Astro, some Hiss Hong Kong are highly controversial and one Miss Hong Kong, publicly sobbed herself after being mass criticized.


Kayi Cheung    • Born
data.text:
Known as the ugliest Miss Hong Kong in the world, while she was booed by audience and she was given nicknamed as Miss Pork Chop by citizens, while there were viewers suggesting to convert Miss Hong Kong into Miss Pork Chop, which is total and complete ironic to describe for

Low popularity among Miss Hong Kong compared to Grace Wong (high ranking member of Amazing Esther's, widely used for minor role and one of most used Jazz Boon's actors, along with Sammy Sum the neutral ex-TVB artist who is independent now, and gained first lead in That's It, Your Highness by Andy Chan), Mandy Wong (spectacle ladies representative, first lead is The Fixer by Poon ka-tak, while she is well known as Guan Er Sao in L'Escargot by Nelson Cheung, most used actress for Lam Chi-wah and Poon ka-tak), and Candice Chiu (known role including Kelly Lui is Master of Play by Jonathan Chik, Yu Kar-wing/Shirley Chung in Officer Geomancer by Nelson Cheung, while she is currently playing younger version of Ling Hung and Tse Nuok-Mai (Chloe Yuen before plastic surgery) in The Unholy Alliance by Jazz Booon)) these neutral TVB artists

Miss Hong Kong 2010 Champion that was highly criticized by citizens for her ugly smiling despite her sweet look, that was given a nickname as Miss Pork Chop, in which it was reported worldwide, particularly on CNN, A Time Warner Company, that makes her often looking out when she smiles, while she seldom smiles

Has popularity in TVB despite ugly smiling, and she is Lam Chi-wah's highly used actress, that has prominence characters like Ivy Yip in Dead Wrong, and also a LGBT character named Poon Oun aka Annie in The Unlawful Justice Squad, and she earned her first lead in Brothers, all of them are created by Lam Chi-wah

Known as "First Miss Hong Kong to be described as ugly one", that was selected by Jackie Chan, instead of Kenix Kwok the mass awaited Miss Hong Kong, that Jackie Chan favored her for high qualification as a graduate from Basel Gewerbe Schule Immunology and Molecular Biology, while he believes that it's a solace for him that he failed to finish school for poverty background when he was young

The Miss Hong Kong that late Sir Run Run Shaw didn't like, that she was absent for any important event related to him, including TVB Anniversary Celebration that was also his birthday celebration before his death in 2014 thanks to natural causes

Although highly prized in TV acting, she is also criticized for acting skills in film, that earned Worst Female Lead in Golden Plum Award 2014 by Next Media, for her turbulent acting skills in I Love Hong Kong 2014, while her acting skills in TVB is turbulence that ranked as "viewership bomb" along with Sandy Yue's highly prized Priscilla Wong, before the appearance of Grace Chan

Winner of Miss Hong Kong 2014 and 2nd runner up in Miss Chinese International 2017, behind Taiwanese Stitch Yu and Malaysian Serene Lim, whom all of them joined TVB, that Serene believes that TVB is better than in Astro that there is no "These No-Majs that must never be Named", instead of highly prized superstars here

​Highly controversial for her turbulence discipline past when she was in high school, and also nicknames as Vulgar Miss Hong Kong that she used to speak vulgars on anti occupy central people and also CY Leung during Umbrella Revolution, in which CY retired himself as chief executive

Winner of Miss Hong Kong 2002 with two side awards, Miss International Goodwill and Modern Style and 1st runner up in Miss Chinese International 2003 1st runner up behind Malaysian one, Rachel Tan, an aspiring independent artist and a legal eagle, and founder of King Street Pictures along with her Hollywood lawyer husband, Dan Mark

Highly criticized that Miss Hong Kong failed to find a high quality one that many pretty young girls became pseudo-model instead, that year Facebook and Bubble HK magazine was not founded yet, which led the anger of TVB high ranking executives that they scolded and slammed the desk on crew, during a meeting

Less welcomed Miss Hong Kong, in which the Miss Hong Kong reputation is quite askew thanks to the falling reputation of TVB and the ban of NextMedia from TVB thanks to terrestrial television licence issue, while Sandy Yue applauded the ban of NextMedia that she had a feud with NextMedia owner, Jimmy Lai, due to a wrong news about the Next Media Animation that already existed in 2007, one year before Sandy Yue joined NextMedia, created Next TV, and also Weather Girls along with L Motion Entertainment, before they are selected to debut in Japan from A-Nation 2012

Highly criticized by Eric Tsang that he believed that the judges of the event was having a myopia and she sobbed publicly in Causeway Bay for being unable to receive hard criticism

Quite askew in her acting skills that she is labelled as Sisley Choi's successor, that her acting skill is horrendous in Fashion War, a fashion office politics series by Dave Fong, while Sisley Choi improves her skills, and her acting skillis same as Grace Chan the Miss Hong Kong 2013 and Miss Chinese International 2014 Champion, that they are highly criticized for skills, while Grace herself ranked as top 10 most hated entertainers in Hong Kong during 2017 Chinese New Year
